tech.name: java
tech.desc: Java is a widely-used programming language known for its platform independence and extensive library support.

tech.name: javascript
tech.desc: JavaScript is a versatile scripting language primarily used for web development.

tech.name: go
tech.desc: Go, also known as Golang, is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed for simplicity and efficiency.

tech.name: typescript
tech.desc: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing and other features to enhance large-scale application development.

tech.name: python
tech.desc: Python is a high-level programming language known for its simplicity and readability.

tech.name: ruby
tech.desc: Ruby is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language known for its simplicity and productivity.

tech.name: c++
tech.desc: C++ is a powerful, general-purpose programming language known for its performance and versatility.

tech.name: rust
tech.desc: Rust is a systems programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency.

tech.name: swift
tech.desc: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language created by Apple for building iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps.

tech.name: c
tech.desc: C is a general-purpose, procedural programming language developed in the early 1970s. It is widely used for system programming, embedded programming, and developing portable software.

tech.name: html
tech.desc: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications. It defines the structure and content of a web page.

tech.name: c#
tech.desc: C# (C Sharp) is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft. It is widely used for building desktop, web, and mobile applications, as well as game development with Unity.
